div.script: /* hide the page title because we're showing it outside the content container */ jQuery(document).ready(function(){ jQuery('h2.entry-title').hide(); });
div.h1: Welcome to the Henry W. Moore School

div.p: We believe that "Schools are for Children". As such, Henry W. Moore School celebrates our commitment to quality education, academic rigor and high standards for student achievement. We value perseverance and problem solving as essential skills for all students to succeed.

header.h2: Welcome to the Henry W. Moore School

li.p:
I hope that you are all wearing your blue and white because today is Lancer Pride Day! Please send me your spirit day pictures by Tuesday, April 28th if you would like them included in the Spirit Week video.
If you have any books from our school library or teacher libraries in your home we would love to have you drop them off at the school. Today they can be dropped off from 7:00am until 4:00pm. There is a container for returning books outside the main entrance of the building. Next week they can be dropped off Monday - Thursday (4/27...

Today is “favorite holiday” day! Let’s continue to celebrate our Moore School spirit by wearing something that represents your favorite holiday. The schedule of spirit days can be found on our distance learning website. Please send me pictures of your child participating in spirit days. I will compile the photos into a video to post on our distance learning website.
As a reminder, other activities happening in the home may be heard in the online classroom while your child is in a Zoom meeting. Families should exercise caution with interactions in the background. Loud banging, music or voices may cause...

Today is sports/hobby day! Let’s continue to celebrate our Moore School spirit by wearing something that represents your favorite sport or hobby. The schedule of spirit days can be found on our distance learning website. Please send pictures of your child participating in spirit days. We will compile the photos into a video to post on our distance learning website. You’ve sent some great pictures so far!
If you are the parent of a child in grades 5-8, please remind your child to check their school email. There are still many students who have not yet emailed me from their...

Today is crazy hair/hat day! Let’s continue to celebrate our Moore School spirit by decorating a hat or creating a crazy hairdo today. The schedule of spirit days can be found on our distance learning website. Please send me pictures of your child (or whole family if you wish) participating in our spirit days. I will compile the photos into a video to post on our distance learning website for all to see.
Speaking of photos, Mr. Pritchard is very pleased with the yearbook pictures that he has received. Don’t forget to send in a picture of...

Today is pajama day! We are celebrating our Moore School spirit with dress up days this week. The schedule of days can be found on our distance learning website. Please feel free to send me pictures of your child (or whole family if you wish) participating in our spirit days. I will compile the pictures into a video to post on our distance learning website for all to see. I do hope everyone will participate.
As a reminder, students in grades K-4 have a unified arts class each day of the week. There is a short (less than 5 minute)...

Today is day 25 of distance learning. As you know, we will be learning remotely for the remainder of the school year. Once a decision is made regarding the last day of school, I will be sure to communicate that to you. I would also like to reassure you that we will be celebrating our 8th grade students. We are working on a celebration to be held during the summer months. As those plans are finalized over the next few weeks, I will be communicating them to 8th grade families.
We would like to have a virtual “Spirit Week” next week...

h2.a: Governor Extends Remote Learning for Remainder of School Year

p.a: Please click here to view the Superintendent’s Letter Regarding School Closure (PDF)

li.p: Today is day 24 of distance learning. We would like to request that you let us know if your child will not be “attending” school as you do when school is open. If your child is ill and will not be able to attend to their schoolwork for the day, please email candia.attendance@sau15.net to let us know. Also, please make sure that you are touching base with teachers if your child is having any trouble understanding or completing assignments for any reason. We are here to help.

Today is day 23 of distance learning. I know that keeping track of distance learning assignments at home can feel overwhelming for both parents and students. Below are two features in Google Classroom that can help students keep track of their work.
1. The ‘To Do’ feature on the left hand menu of the Google Classroom home page shows work that is due in all classes. This video shows how to access that list: https://youtu.be/PTVoG_d8HUM?t=23. This is an easy way to check if your child has completed their work in Google Classroom for the week. Simply ask your child to...

Today is day 22 of distance learning. Please make sure to let us know if you are having any trouble accessing materials or Zoom links through Google Classroom. Also remember that you can reach out to the candia.helpdesk@sau15.net if you need any assistance with technology.
